name: Goldbach conjecture
rephrased: Every even number greater than two can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.
implication_form: If a number is even and greater than two, then it can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.
explained: Goldbach's conjecture states that every even natural number greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers. For example, 4 = 2 + 2, 6 = 3 + 3, 8 = 3 + 5, 10 = 3 + 7 or 5 + 5, and so on. While this has been verified for all even numbers up to 4 × 10¹⁸, it remains an unproven conjecture in mathematics.
related_conjectures: Weak Goldbach conjecture (stating that every odd integer greater than 5 can be expressed as the sum of three primes)
Twin prime conjecture (concerning the infinitude of prime pairs differing by 2)
